data.enText: to cut sth into two pieces; to cut sth off sth

data.chText: 他的手从胳膊上截断了。
data.enText: His hand was severed from his arm.
to completely end a relationship or all communication with sb

data.chText: 两国断绝了一切外交关系。
data.enText: The two countries have severed all diplomatic links .

example: His head was severed from his body
The soul discerped from the body

value.def: To sever something means to cut completely through it or to cut it completely off.

example.ex: Richardson severed his right foot in a motorbike accident.
example.tran: 理查森在一次摩托车事故中失去了他的右脚。

example.ex: ...oil still gushing from a severed fuel line.
example.tran: 石油仍然从被切断的燃料运输管中喷涌而出

value.def: If you sever a relationship or connection that you have with someone, you end it suddenly and completely.

example.ex: She severed her ties with England...
example.tran: 她断绝了和英国的往来。

example.ex: He was able to sever all emotional bonds to his family.
example.tran: 他切断了和家人的所有感情纽带。
